title: India’s Global Rise Imperiled by Perpetual Pakistan Conflict
content: India and Pakistan on Wednesday hit each other with military strikes for the sixth time since 1947, when Britain pulled out of the subcontinent and both nations won independence.

title: Taiwan Doesn’t Expect to Be Named Currency Manipulator by US
content: Taiwan’s central bank governor dismissed the possibility of being labeled a currency manipulator by the US Treasury.

title: Philippines GDP Growth of 5.4% Misses, Even Before Tariff Impact
content: The Philippine economy expanded slower than expected in the first quarter, underscoring challenges for policymakers even before the Trump administration’s trade war rocked markets and hurt global sentiment.

title: Mid-Term Vote Holds Key to Philippines Riding Out Tariff-Linked Risks
content: The Philippines’ May 12 midterm election is putting investors on alert for any changes to government policies, as the global trade war exposes weaknesses in one of Asia’s fastest-growing economies.

title: Xi Fortifies China Economy Before First Trade Talks With US
content: President Xi Jinping’s government provided a jolt to China’s economy ahead of landmark trade talks with the US, with officials unveiling a range of policies designed to strengthen Beijing’s hand in negotiations.

title: Willis Queried RBNZ Rates, Meeting Frequency Before Orr Quit
content: New Zealand Minister of Finance Nicola Willis asked the central bank to explain why it planned to keep interest rates at a restrictive level in the week prior to the sudden resignation of Governor Adrian Orr, documents obtained under the Official Information Act show.

title: Mexican Leaders Cheer Apollo’s Rowan for Pushing US-Mexico Deal
content: Mexican business leaders and executives lauded statements from Apollo Global Management Inc. Chief Executive Officer Marc Rowan emphasizing the need for a trade partnership between the US and Mexico, which propelled a view that a global trade war could make the US’ southern neighbor a winner amid uncertainty.

title: JLR, Diageo Among Winners as UK-India Sign Model Trade Deal
content: India’s decision to slash tariffs on UK-made cars to whiskey as part of a sweeping trade pact could create a line of winners, including Jaguar Land Rover and Diageo Plc.

title: Brazil Lifts Interest Rate to Nearly Two-Decade High of 14.75%
content: Brazil’s central bank raised its interest rate by a half-point and kept its options open for either another hike or a pause at its next decision as policymakers face above-target inflation and global economic uncertainty.

title: Corporate Defaults Start Piling Up in Argentina as Milei Policies Kick In
content: Cracks are starting to appear as Javier Milei removes the distortions that once characterized the Argentine economy, hurting companies that bulked up on debt by exploiting exchange rate gaps.

title: UK House Sales Gauge Hits Lowest Since 2023, Estate Agents Say
content: A closely watched indicator of the UK housing market plunged to the lowest level in almost two years after a property tax increase and Donald Trump’s trade war sent buyers into hiding.

title: Bank of England Set to Turn Dovish as US Tariffs Risk Growth
content: The Bank of England is expected to cut interest rates by a quarter percentage point Thursday and may signal that another move is likely in June, potentially putting the central bank on course for its first back-to-back reductions since 2009 as the US trade war darkens the outlook for growth.

title: Starmer Pledges UK Workers to Gain From Military Spending Boost
content: Prime Minister Keir Starmer said British workers would benefit from the UK’s plans to boost military spending, as his government tries to convince a skeptical and disgruntled electorate of the merits of increased outlays on defense.

title: Reeves to Break Fiscal Rule by £57 Billion Ahead of Next Budget
content: Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves is on track to miss both her fiscal rules by tens of billions of pounds in the UK’s autumn budget, according to a prominent economic think tank, leaving her no option but to raise taxes or cut spending.

title: Powell Says Fed Won’t Be Rushed, Outlook Depends on White House
content: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell made clear he won’t be rushed into lowering borrowing costs until there’s more certainty on the direction of trade policy, which will have to come from the White House.

title: Lawyers Are Quoting $1 Million in Fees to Get Pardons to Trump
content: One pardon recipient recalls the president telling him, ‘You’re cleaner than a baby’s bottom.’

title: Trump’s Migrant Crackdown Adds to Miami’s Real Estate Woes
content: President Donald Trump’s immigration crackdown is making it harder for foreigners to buy and rent homes, threatening a key pillar of Miami’s half-decade-long economic boom.

title: Looking to Nixon for a Peek at Trump’s Future
content: Niall Ferguson and Fareed Zakaria join this week’s Trumponomics to place Donald Trump’s ambitious plans for the US economy in historical perspective.

title: Goldman Boosts Forecast for US Inflation as Dollar Slides
content: Economists at Goldman Sachs Group Inc. boosted their forecasts for US inflation this year and next, in part to account for a weaker dollar following the Trump administration’s tariff announcements.

title: Next Lifts Guidance Again as UK Shoppers Buck Economic Gloom
content: Next Plc’s shares rose after the retailer raised its guidance for the second time this year, driven by stronger-than-expected UK sales and disruption facing rivals’ operations.

title: JLR Restarts Shipments to US After Pause Over Tariffs
content: UK automaker Jaguar Land Rover has resumed shipments of vehicles to the US after pausing them following the announcement of tariffs by President Donald Trump’s government.

title: Maersk Cuts Global Container Market Outlook on Tariff War
content: A.P. Moller-Maersk A/S, the Danish container giant, lowered its forecast for the global transport market rattled by Donald Trump’s trade war.

title: Oil Edges Higher as Trump Signals Announcement on Trade Deal
content: Oil rose after Donald Trump flagged a Thursday announcement on a trade deal, which is expected to be with the UK, as the US president faces political pressure following tariffs that rattled global markets.

title: $73 Billion Stonepeak Expands Middle East Presence with Riyadh Office
content: Infrastructure specialist Stonepeak is opening an office in Saudi Arabia — its second in the Middle East, a region eager for foreign institutional investment.

title: Chinese Automakers Crank Up Sales of Cars With Combustion Engines in Europe
content: Chinese electric vehicles are losing momentum in Europe, but the nation’s automakers are selling more cars than ever in the region by throttling up deliveries of hybrids and combustion engine-powered models.

title: ANZ Extends Share Buyback Period Amid Trump’s Tariff Uncertainty
content: ANZ Group Holdings Ltd. moved to extend the time it has to complete its A$2 billion ($1.3 billion) share buyback, citing uncertainty in global conditions.

title: Australia’s US Envoy Calls Trump Film Tariffs a ‘Tax on Bluey’
content: Australia’s Ambassador to the US Kevin Rudd labeled Donald Trump’s plan to impose a 100% tariff on foreign-made films as a “tax on Bluey,” bringing the hugely popular children’s character into a series of recent trade disagreements between the two countries.

title: Blackstone, Vanguard, Wellington to Launch Private Markets Fund
content: Blackstone Inc., Vanguard Group and Wellington Management Co are launching a fund that will invest in public equities, bonds and private markets, as part of their effort to expand private-market offerings to retail clients.

title: Cash-Strapped Beyond Meat Gets $100 Million From Diet Non-Profit
content: Beyond Meat Inc. raised $100 million in debt financing from a plant-based diets advocate, as the company continues to search for funds to shore up its liquidity.

title: Carvana Sees Stronger Profit on Used-Car and Loan Sales
content: Online used-car retailer Carvana Co. doubled its profits in the first quarter with record vehicle volume and a substantial gain in loan sales.

title: FAA Moves to Bolster Newark Airspace Strained by Failures
content: The US aviation regulator plans to upgrade technology infrastructure and staffing levels for air-traffic controllers that oversee flights bound for Newark Liberty International Airport after a critical outage led to more than week of severe flight disruptions.

title: BYD, Tsingshan Drop Chile Lithium Projects After Price Rout
content: Two Chinese companies dropped plans to develop lithium-processing projects in Chile after the price of the battery metal tumbled, undermining the nation’s bid to add more value to its mineral exports.

title: APA Reaches Deal to Sell New Mexico Assets to Permian Resources
content: APA Corp., a US oil explorer with wells from Egypt to Alaska, said it’s selling some of its assets in the world’s busiest shale patch to Permian Resources Corp. as it streamlines its portfolio.

title: Battery Company Fluence Plunges as Tariffs Curb Projects
content: Fluence Energy Inc. shares fell as much as 28% in late trading after the company lowered its full-year guidance, citing the pause of certain US projects due to tariff policy.

title: Trump Taps Means as Surgeon General After Pulling First Pick
content: President Donald Trump is tapping Casey Means to be the next US surgeon general after his prior nominee was withdrawn shortly before her confirmation hearing.

title: AppLovin Sales Jump, Sells Mobile-Games Unit to Tripledot
content: AppLovin Corp. agreed to sell its video-games unit to London-based Tripledot Studios to focus on its advertising technology business.

title: Musk’s xAI to Use Tesla Batteries at Memphis Supercomputer
content: Elon Musk’s xAI is using Tesla Inc.’s Megapack batteries to shore up its “Colossus” supercomputer in Memphis, another example of the overlapping interests between Musk’s companies.

title: Rite Aid to Sell Customer Prescriptions to Rival Pharmacies
content: Rite Aid won court approval to run an expedited process to sell customers’ prescription information to rival pharmacies as the bankrupt firm prepares to unload or close its stores.

title: FanDuel-Parent Flutter Results Miss After March Madness Setback
content: Flutter Entertainment Plc, parent of the FanDuel online betting business, reported sales and earnings that fell short of Wall Street projections after coming up on the losing side of a number of college basketball bets.

title: NY MTA Gets $500 Million Loan Backed by Congestion Toll Revenue
content: New York’s Metropolitan Transportation Authority entered into a $500 million loan agreement with a group of investors that’s backed by congestion pricing revenue as the Trump administration tries to end the tolling program, according to a loan document.

title: Amtrak to Cut 20% of Top-Level Staff Amid Trump Uncertainty
content: Amtrak is cutting roughly 20% of its top-level management staff in an effort to reduce costs amid uncertainty about President Donald Trump’s plans to invest in infrastructure, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Oil Falls as Fed Holds Rates Steady, China Trade Tensions Linger
content: Oil slumped after Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell said officials aren’t in a hurry to adjust rates and as tensions between the US and China linger ahead of trade negotiations.

title: Ramaswamy’s Strive Plans Bitcoin Treasury Firm by Reverse Merger
content: A subsidiary of Strive Enterprises Inc. co-founded by Vivek Ramaswamy is merging with Asset Entities Inc. to form a Bitcoin treasury company, the latest in a string of firms to mimic Michael Saylor’s Strategy.

title: US Airports Have Outlook Dinged by Moody’s on Trade Concerns
content: Moody’s Ratings has revised its outlook for the US airport sector to negative from stable, citing an expected hit to air travel from the global trade war as a key reason for its view.

title: Newark? No Thanks: Flyers Avoid Airport Over Safety Fears
content: Rattled flyers are deciding that trips through Newark just aren’t worth it.

title: FedEx Director Steiner Is Leading Candidate to Run Post Office
content: The United States Postal Service is zeroing in on FedEx Corp. board member David Steiner to be the country’s next postmaster general, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Gramercy Partner Maloney Departs After a Decade With Hedge Fund
content: Matt Maloney, a partner at Gramercy Funds Management, has left after a decade with the emerging-market focused hedge fund, people familiar with the matter said.

title: Hedge Fund Eisler Cuts 15% of Staff in Overhaul to Trim Costs
content: Eisler Capital has dismissed about 15% of its workforce as it looks to reduce costs amid declining assets and trading losses.

title: Disney Shares Surge as Parks, Streaming Results Lift Outlook
content: Walt Disney Co. reported fiscal second-quarter results that beat Wall Street estimates and raised its outlook for the full year, citing strong performances from theme parks and streaming TV. The shares jumped as much as 12% in New York.

title: Rove, founded by a 22-year-old, is helping Gen Z earn airline miles without credit cards
content: During his junior year study abroad, Max Morganroth, traveled to 30 countries, primarily flying in business and first class. His jet-setting was funded

title: Is credit card debt forgiveness smart for seniors? Here's what experts think.
content: Debt forgiveness can provide relief for some seniors, but it's important to know when it is and isn't a wise move.

title: Trump slams Newsom after California governor proposes federal film tax credit to "Make America Film Again"
content: President Trump slammed Gavin Newsom on Tuesday, just hours after the California governor asked for collaboration on a massive national film tax credit.

title: Credit Suisse to pay $511M for helping Americans evade $4B in taxes
content: Credit Suisse has pleaded guilty to criminal charges and agreed to pay $511 million for helping wealthy Americans hide more than $4 billion.

title: The AP Will Not Change Nick Ut's Credit on 'Napalm Girl' Photo
content: The AP has released an extensive report looking at whether Nick Ut is the author of the Vietnam War Napalm Girl image.

title: Royal Credit Union partnering with local non-profits for diaper drive
content: Donations will be accepted between May 1 and May 31, 2025.

title: Newsom suggests tax credit for Hollywood after Trump proposes tariffs on foreign films
content: California Gov. Gavin Newsom reached out to the Trump administration on Monday with hopes that the two can pair up and create a $7.5 billion federal film tax credit to help out the movie business.

title: How holding rates steady affects you
content: From credit cards and mortgage rates to auto loans and savings accounts, all sorts of consumer borrowing costs are impacted by Fed moves.

title: Credit Suisse fined for helping rich Americans hide over $4 billion from the taxman
content: A Credit Suisse unit has pleaded guilty to US charges of helping ultra-wealthy Americans evade taxes and will pay a fine of more than $510 million.

title: Trump overhypes $5 trillion in private US investments pledges
content: Presidents often claim credit for the good things that happen while they’re in office. But Trump is taking things to a new level.

title: SEC’s Anti-Fraud Public Service Campaign Warns Investors About Relationship Investment Scams
content: The SEC’s Office of Investor Education and Advocacy unveiled its anti-fraud public service campaign, which warns investors about the devastating impact relationship investment scams can have on their financial future.

content:

title: By Building Wealth, Investors Power U.S. Economy
content: April is Financial Literacy Month, and the SEC is encouraging investors to utilize the agency’s saving and investing resources on Investor.gov.

title: SEC Charges Three Arizona Individuals with Defrauding Investors in $284 Million Municipal Bond Offering That Financed Sports Complex
content: The Securities and Exchange Commission today charged Randall “Randy” Miller, Chad Miller, and Jeffrey De Laveaga with creating false documents that were provided to investors in two municipal bond offerings that raised $284 million to build one of the…

content:
The Securities and Exchange Commission today voted to end its defense of the rules requiring disclosure of climate-related risks and greenhouse gas emissions.

title: SEC Crypto Task Force to Host Four More Roundtables
content: The SEC&#039;s Crypto Task Force will hold four more roundtables in its ongoing series discussing crypto asset regulation.

content:
The Securities and Exchange Commission today announced the agenda and panelists for the March 27 roundtable on artificial intelligence in the financial industry.

content: The Securities and Exchange Commission today announced that it has filed charges against David Yow Shang Chiueh of East Hanover, New Jersey and his investment advisory firm, Upright Financial Corp., for misconduct and for investing more than 25…

content: The Securities and Exchange Commission today announced a six-month extension of the compliance dates for amendments adopted in September 2023 to the Investment Company Act “Names Rule,” which addresses fund names likely to mislead investors about a fund’…

content: The Securities and Exchange Commission today filed settled charges against registered investment adviser Momentum Advisors LLC, its former managing partner Allan J. Boomer, and its former chief operating officer and partner Tiffany L. Hawkins, for…

content: The Securities and Exchange Commission is providing extensive guidance and resources to assist filers with upcoming access and account management enhancements to the security of the agency’s Electronic Data Gathering, Analysis, and Retrieval (EDGAR)…

title: SEC Crypto Task Force to Host Roundtable on Security Status
content: The SEC&#039;s Crypto Task Force will host a series of roundtables to discuss key areas of interest in the regulation of crypto assets.

title: SEC Staff Facilitates Capital Formation for Companies Planning Public Offerings
content:
The Securities and Exchange Commission today announced that its Division of Corporation Finance is further facilitating capital formation by enhancing the accommodations available to companies for nonpublic review of draft registration statements.

content:
The Securities and Exchange Commission today announced the members of the Crypto Task Force staff, which is advising the Commission on matters related to crypto.



The task force is composed of staff from the Acting Chairman’s office and other divisions…

title: SEC to Host Roundtable on Artificial Intelligence
content: The SEC will hold a roundtable discussion on artificial intelligence and examine the risks, benefits, and governance of it in the financial industry.

title: How Embedded Finance Is Quietly Transforming Startup Business Models
content: Traditional banks are having a hard time keeping up with customers' expectations for embedded finance. In this guest commentary, Arthur Azizov, founder and investor at B2 Ventures, provides some answers to what customers want and why they want it.

title: Tariffs And The Venture Value Chain: A Blip Or Long-Term Pain?
content: Guest author Rohit Yadav takes us on an exploration of the value chain — VC fundraising, startup fundraising and exits — to see how tariffs are driving both direct and indirect impacts.

title: The Longer IPOs Delay, The Less Likely Debuts Will Happen
content: Over the past couple weeks, as we’ve seen Klarna, StubHub and others delay scheduled pre-IPO roadshows, it appears markets are to blame. But how will delays affect a company's success when it finally makes its debut?

title: Crypto Startup Ripple Buys Hidden Road For $1.25B
content: Crypto payments firm Ripple is acquiring brokerage house Hidden Road for $1.25 billion in one of the biggest M&A deals ever in crypto.

title: Tariffs, Volatility And The Startup Exit Dilemma
content: Even seasoned startup investors today face what feels like a novel turn of events: a potential recession and increasing exit uncertainty due to government-induced volatility, writes guest author Don Butler of Thomvest Ventures.  For an ecosystem that has long awaited the return of robust exit volumes, the uncertainty in the markets sparked by tariffs couldn’t come at a worse time.

title: CoreWeave Closes Flat In First-Day Trading
content: Shares of CoreWeave closed flat at $40 on their first day of trading on the Nasdaq today. Shares had opened at $39 on Friday, a day when the Nasdaq sank 2.7%.

title: CoreWeave Shrinks IPO
content: Cloud computing startup CoreWeave is cutting the size of its IPO, looking for a valuation closer to $23 billion than the roughly $30 billion it had originally targeted.

title: Want To Sell Your Startup Quickly To A Strategic Buyer? Consider This From The Get-Go
content: Whether buying a startup or selling one, there are plenty of steps that need to be considered, writes guest author Murat Abdrakhmanov. In this commentary he provides recommendations to help both buyer and seller reach their strategic and financial goals.

title: The Most-Active, Spendiest Startup Investors Are Lagging Greatly In Lucrative Exits
content: The most active, highest-spending startup investors are leading a lot of large new rounds lately. When it comes to exits, however, things look much, much slower. We used Crunchbase data to examine IPO and M&A exits since 2023 for six firms that regularly top our active lead investor rankings.

title: Forget Startups. Maybe The Most Adaptable Companies Are Those That Last Centuries
content: Building a lasting business can take an exceedingly long time, but it's nothing compared to hundreds of well-known, successful organizations and brands that can trace their roots back not in years or decades but in centuries. Here's a look at a few of them.

title: With Turo Withdrawal, A Slim IPO Pipeline Gets Thinner
content: Peer-to-peer car rental platform Turo became the latest venture unicorn to withdraw plans for a public offering.

title: Adapting The IPO Roadmap For Today’s Market
content: The path to IPO has become slower and more arduous for companies looking for an exit, writes Fiunder Shield's COO Carl Niedbala. In this guest commentary he lays out some effective measures to help founders be prepared when an opportunity presents itself.

title: Q1 Global Startup Funding Posts Strongest Quarter Since Q2 2022 With A Third Going To Massive OpenAI Deal
content: Overall, the first quarter of 2025 marked the strongest one for venture investment since Q2 2022. Funding was up 17% quarter over quarter from the $96 billion reached in Q4 2024.

title: Global Venture Funding Slowed In April, Despite Strong AI Showing
content: Global venture funding totaled $23 billion in April 2025, flat year over year and down significantly month over month from $68 billion invested in March, Crunchbase data shows.

title: How To Leverage Your Pre-Seed Funding For Rapid And Successful Growth
content: After the pre-seed round is a time for a startup to plan for securing follow-on investments, says guest author Sergei Bogdanov, who shares early-stage funding advice to founders regarding what to do as well as what not to do.

title: Most-Active Startup Investors Spent More In Q1
content: The busiest venture backers upped their game in the recently ended first quarter. Among the 14 most-active post-seed investors, a majority backed more deals in Q1 2025 than they did a year ago.

title: Europe’s VC Funding Stayed Flat In Q1, Even As Healthcare Added A Third
content: Europe’s venture funding plateaued at $12.6 billion in Q1 2025 — flat quarter over quarter and year over year, Crunchbase data shows. Without the sort of outsized AI funding rounds seen in North America in the first quarter, the continent’s share of global funding also fell.

title: Latin America Startup Funding Fell Sequentially In Q1
content: Latin America startup investment declined sequentially in the first quarter of this year, driven by a drop in later-stage dealmaking. Even so, funding was above the depressed levels seen a year ago, and early-stage dealmaking showed signs of strength.

title: SignalFire Closes On $1B To Invest In Applied AI
content: Bay Area-based SignalFire, a data-driven venture firm, has raised $1 billion for its fifth and largest fund, which it will invest in applied AI companies.

title: North America Startup Investment Spiked In Q1 Due To OpenAI, But Seed And Early Stage Fell
content: Despite several big deals that buoyed the numbers, North America early- and seed-stage investment declined to multiquarter lows in Q1, and reported round counts fell across stages.

title: Q1 Global Startup Funding Posts Strongest Quarter Since Q2 2022 With A Third Going To Massive OpenAI Deal
content: Overall, the first quarter of 2025 marked the strongest one for venture investment since Q2 2022. Funding was up 17% quarter over quarter from the $96 billion reached in Q4 2024.

title: 7 Deadly Pitch Deck Sins, According To A VC
content: VC firms receive thousands of pitch decks a year and a typical investor will spend no more than two to three minutes assessing each one. In this guest commentary, investor Michael Tefula of Ada Ventures shares seven of the biggest mistakes that are more likely to land your pitch in the “no, thanks” rejection bin.

title: Far Fewer Seed-Stage Startups Are Graduating To Series A — Raising The Risk Of Failure
content: Companies stalled at the seed stage might be sacrificing growth to get to breakeven, which could further hinder their ability to show the traction needed to get to a Series A.

title: Seed Funding Rose In These Spaces
content: Even as overall seed-stage investment declined in 2024, a few areas saw big gains. This includes the obvious category — AI — as well as a subset of sectors largely focused on automating things that humans currently do. We take a look at four top picks.

title: Q1 Global Startup Funding Posts Strongest Quarter Since Q2 2022 With A Third Going To Massive OpenAI Deal
content: Overall, the first quarter of 2025 marked the strongest one for venture investment since Q2 2022. Funding was up 17% quarter over quarter from the $96 billion reached in Q4 2024.
